title: Cosmic Shielding works with Aethero to protect Nvidia Jetson Orin NX GPU
summary: Cosmic Shielding Corp. is supporting the upcoming launch of a radiation-hardened edge computer from San Francisco startup Aethero.

title: Yes, you should be a little freaked out about Hurricane Beryl
summary: "It's hard to communicate how unbelievable this is."

title: Bente Eegholm: Ensuring Space Telescopes Have Stellar Vision
summary: Bente Eegholm is an optical engineer working to ensure missions like the Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope have stellar vision. When it launches by May 2027, the Roman mission will shed light on many astrophysics topics, like dark energy, which are currently shrouded in mystery. Bente’s past work has included Earth-observing missions and the James […]

title: Can “AltPNT” Really Replace GPS?
summary: Realistically, there is no singular solution to replace GPS, but we can make it more resilient with complementary AltPNT technologies.

title: How the Applied Physics Laboratory is tackling Artemis moon exploration
summary: The Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) is tackling many of the challenges facing crewed Artemis missions.

title: Save Freedom: We must stop the destruction of the International Space Station
summary: Rick Tumlinson writes that the International Space Station must be preserved rather than destroyed in reentry.

title: NASA Stennis Achieves Primary Success for Historic In-Space Mission
summary: NASA’s Stennis Space Center and partner Sidus Space Inc. announced primary mission success July 2 for the center’s historic in-space mission – an autonomous systems payload aboard an orbiting satellite. “Our ASTRA (Autonomous Satellite Technology for Resilient Applications) payload is active and operational,” NASA Stennis Center Director John Bailey said. “This is an incredible achievement […]

title: Mission Success: HERA Crew Successfully Completes 45-Day Simulated Journey to Mars
summary: Four dedicated explorers—Jason Lee, Stephanie Navarro, Shareef Al Romaithi, and Piyumi Wijesekara—just returned from a 45-day simulated journey to Mars, testing the boundaries of human endurance and teamwork within NASA’s HERA (Human Exploration Research Analog) habitat at Johnson Space Center in Houston. Their groundbreaking work on HERA’s Campaign 7 Mission 2 contributes to NASA’s efforts to […]

title: Sidereus Space Dynamics Complete Integrated Static Fire Test
summary: Italian rocket builder Sidereus Space Dynamics has completed the first integrated system test of its EOS rocket. Founded in 2019, Sidereus Space Dynamics is developing a diminutive rocket called EOS, which will be capable of delivering 13-kilogram payloads to low Earth orbit. Standing at just 4.2 metres in height, the single-stage-to-orbit rocket is designed to […]

title: Orbit Fab completes ground test of satellite fueling payload
summary: The company’s refueling nozzle was tested at the Air Force Research Laboratory
